Event Description:
Get ready to laugh your circuits off! GiggleBytes is TechXplore 2K25's premier comedy event where tech meets humor. Whether you're a coding comedian or a debugging diva, this is your stage to showcase wit with a technological twist.
Participants will perform standup comedy routines incorporating technology themes, programming jokes, IT culture references, and digital age humor. From bugs to features, algorithms to user interfaces â€“ everything tech is fair game for your comedic genius!
Rules & Regulations: Participants must have basic computer and programming knowledge
Challenges involve solving coding problems and finding hidden files to retrieve flags
Internet use is allowed but using AI tools and Cyberchef is strictly prohibited
Personal gadgets like mobile phones and smart watches are not allowed
Any form of malpractice will lead to immediate disqualification
Further detailed rules will be provided on the day of event
Event Guidelines: Arrival Time: Participants must arrive 30 minutes before their slot
Recording: Event may be recorded for promotional purposes
Prizes: Exciting prizes for top 2 performers
Certificate: All participants will receive participation certificates
Networking: Great opportunity to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts
Technical Support: Basic AV support will be provided

Participants will perform standup comedy routines incorporating technology themes, programming jokes, IT culture references, and digital age humor. From bugs to features, algorithms to user interfaces â€“ everything tech is fair game for your comedic genius!
Rules & Regulations: Team Formation: Each team must consist of 2 participants from the same or different departments.
Single Device Rule:Only one device (laptop/phone) per team is allowed during the quiz.
Fair Play:Use of the internet, books, or external help during the quiz is strictly prohibited. Any malpractice will lead to disqualification.
Time Limit:Each question must be answered within the given time frame. Late submissions will not be considered.
Scoring:Correct answers carry positive points; no negative marking unless specified by the quiz master.
QUIZ IS BASED ON TECH & PROGRAMMING
